message_1: If a transposition cipher shuffles every three letters of the message "MATHEMATICS" in reverse order, what will be the encrypted message?
message_2:
To encrypt the message "MATHEMATICS" using a transposition cipher that shuffles every three letters in reverse order, we first divide the message into groups of three letters:

MAT - HEM - ATI - CS

Now, we reverse the order of the letters in each group:

TAM - MEH - ITA - SC

Finally, we combine the groups to form the encrypted message:

TAMMEHITASC
